  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, processing.core.PConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnchorZone, ButtonZone, CheckBoxZone, ContainerZone, ImageZone, KeyboardZone, KeyZone, LeftPopUpMenuZone, MainZone, PatternUnlockZone, PieMenuZone, ShapeZone, SlideRevealZone, SliderZone, SwipeKeyboard, TabZone, TextureZone, TextZone, ViewportZone, ViewportZone.Container

    public class Zone
extends PGraphics3DDelegate
implements processing.core.PConstants, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    This is the main zone class which all other Zones extend. It holds the zone's coordinates, size, matrices, etc.. Zones are used to draw and interact with the sketch/application.

    • Method Detail

      • invokeDraw

        public void invokeDraw()
        Prepares and invokes the appropriate draw function. If there is a draw funtion in the processing applet for this zone, that function is called. Otherwise, if there is drawImpl override from a subclass, that function is called. Otherwise, the draw function is called.

      • invokeDrawMethod

        public void invokeDrawMethod()
        Selects and invokes the appropriate draw method

      • invokePickDraw

        public void invokePickDraw()
        Prepares and invokes the appropriate pick draw function. If there is a pick draw funtion in the processing applet for this zone, that function is called. Otherwise, if there is pickDrawImpl override from a subclass, that function is called. Otherwise, the pickDraw function is called.

      • invokePickDrawMethod

        public void invokePickDrawMethod()
        Selects and invokes the appropriate pick draw method

      • invokeTouch

        protected void invokeTouch()
        Prepares and invokes the appropriate touch function. If there is a touch funtion in the processing applet for this zone, that function is called. Otherwise, if there is touchImpl override from a subclass, that function is called. Otherwise, the touch function is called.

      • loadMethods

        protected void loadMethods(java.lang.String name,
                           boolean warnDraw,
                           boolean warnTouch,
                           boolean warnKeys,
                           boolean warnPick,
                           boolean warnTouchUDM,
                           boolean warnPress)
        Prepares all of the methods for this zone.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the zone to load methods from, used as a suffix
        warnDraw - Display a warning when the draw method doesn't exist
        warnTouch - Display a warning when the touch method doesn't exist
        warnKeys - Display a warning when the keyTyped/keyPressed/keyReleased methods don't exist
        warnPick - Display a warning when the pickDraw method doesn't exist
        warnTouchUDM - Display a warning when the touchUp/touchDown/touchMoved methods don't exist
        warnPress - Display a warning when the touchPress methods don't exist

                 boolean drag_right,
                 boolean drag_up,
                 boolean drag_down,
                 int limit_left,
                 int limit_right,
                 int limit_up,
                 int limit_down)
        Performs translate on this zone, using the first assigned touch's movement.
        Parameters:
        drag_left - Allow dragging left
        drag_right - Allow dragging Right
        drag_up - Allow dragging Up
        drag_down - Allow dragging Down
        limit_left - Limit on how far to be able to drag left
        limit_right - Limit on how far to be able to drag right
        limit_up - Limit on how far to be able to drag up
        limit_down - Limit on how far to be able to drag down

      • rst

        public void rst()
        Performs rotate/scale/translate 'gesture' on the zone.

      • rst

        public void rst(boolean rotate,
                boolean scale,
                boolean translate)
        * Performs rotate/scale/translate 'gesture' on the zone.
        Parameters:
        rotate - Whether rotation should happen
        scale - Whether scaling should happen
        translate - Whether tranlation should happen

      • rst

        public void rst(boolean rotate,
                boolean scale,
                boolean translate_x,
                boolean translate_y)
        Performs rotate/scale/translate 'gesture' on the zone.
        Parameters:
        rotate - Whether rotation should happen
        scale - Whether scaling should happen
        translate_x - Whether tranlation in the x direction should happen
        translate_y - Whether tranlation in the y direction should happen

      • rs

        public void rs()
        Rotates and scales the zone. Uses two touches. Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch()

      • rnt

        public void rnt()
        Rotate and translate. Single finger gesture, Which only translates inside of the rotation radius, and rotates and translates outside of this radius. Using a default radius of min(width, height)/4, A quarter of the smallest side of the zone. Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch().

      • pinch

        public void pinch()
        Scales the zone. Uses two touches Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch()

      • scale

        public void scale()
        Rotates the zone, using two touches, about the centre Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch()

      • rotate

        public void rotate()
        Rotates the zone, using two touches, about the centre Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch()

      • rotateAbout

                        int x,
                        int y)

        public void hSwipe()

        public void hSwipe(int leftLimit,
                   int rightLimit)
        Horizontal Swipe. Uses a single touch. Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch(). Limits are absolute and are in global coordinates.
        Parameters:
        leftLimit - Limit on how far to be able to drag left
        rightLimit - Limit on how far to be able to drag right

        Parameters:

        downLimit - Limit on how far to be able to drag down

      • swipeLeft

        public void swipeLeft()

      • swipeRight

      • swipeDown

        public void swipeDown()
        Swipe which only allows moving down. Uses a single touch. Only works inside the zone's touch method, or between calls to beginTouch() and endTouch()

      • toss

        public void toss()
        Tosses a zone. Acts similarly to drag while the touch is on the zone, but when the touch is released, the zone slides for a bit, then slows to a stop.

        public void setTouchable(boolean enabled)

        Parameters:

      • isDirect

        public boolean isDirect()
        Check state of the direct flag. The direct flag controls whether rendering directly onto parent/screen/pickBuffer (direct), or into an image (not direct) If drawing into an image we have assured size(cant draw outside of zone), and background() will work for just the zone, but we lose a large amount of performance.
        Returns:
        whether zone is rendering directly onto screen/pickBuffer, or not

      • setDirect

        public void setDirect(boolean enabled)
        Change state of the direct flag. The direct flag controls whether rendering directly onto parent/screen/pickBuffer (direct), or into an image (not direct) If drawing into an image we have assured size(cant draw outside of zone), and background() will work for just the zone, but we lose a large amount of performance.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Whether the direct flag should be enabled

      • extraGraphicsNullCheck

        protected void extraGraphicsNullCheck()
        Ensures that the extra_graphics object is initialized if it's supposed to be.

      • refreshResolution

        public void refreshResolution()
        This method refreshes this zone's offscreen graphics buffer's resolution to match the size the zone is being drawn at. To put it simply, if you scale an indirect zone, it'll get fuzzy. If you scale an indirect zone, then call this method, it won't get fuzzy. This method does nothing to normal, 'direct', zones.

      • setResolution

        public void setResolution(java.awt.Dimension desired_size)
        Set the resolution of the internal graphics object used by this zone (if it is indirect). This method does nothing to normal, 'direct', zones.
        Parameters:
        desired_size - the desired resolution of the internal graphics object

      • initExtraGraphics

        protected void initExtraGraphics()
        Resizes the extra_graphics object to match the current dimensions of the Zone

      • setCaptureTouches

        public void setCaptureTouches(boolean enabled)
        Set whether this zone will capture touches or not. Normally, zones "capture" touches. This means that normally when touches exit a zone, they remain assigned to that zone. This "capturing" behavior, however, can be disabled. This is commonly done with buttons and other undraggable UI elements.
        Parameters:
        enabled - whether touch capturing should be enabled

      • getCaptureTouches

        public boolean getCaptureTouches()
        Check whether this zone will capture touches or not. Normally, zones "capture" touches. This means that normally when touches exit a zone, they remain assigned to that zone. This "capturing" behavior, however, can be disabled. This is commonly done with buttons and UI elements.
        Returns:
        whether this zone will capture touches or not

        protected java.util.List<TouchPair> getTouchPairs()

      • getTouchPairs

        protected java.util.List<TouchPair> getTouchPairs(int size)
        This takes the touches currently assigned to the Zone and converts them into TouchPairs which are pairs of Touches of the current and previous state of each Touch
        Parameters:
        size - The number of Touches to put into Touchpairs, if greater than the number of assigned Touches on the Zone, it is filled with empty TouchPairs (the Touches in each TouchPair are null)
        Returns:
        A List of TouchPairs, one TouchPair per Touch assigned to the Zone, each TouchPair is the Touch at its current state, and its previous state
